897	{"strain":"C57BL/6J","barcode":"GATCAG","genotyped sex":"Female","diet":"Standard","tissue":"Subcutaneous Fat","age (weeks)":"26","sample":"0664F60"}	{"age (weeks)":"26"}	0664F60_C57BL6J	GSM2113668	GSE80162	mus musculus	sample: 0664F60; strain: C57BL/6J; tissue: Subcutaneous Fat; age (weeks): 26; genotyped sex: Female; diet: Standard; barcode: GATCAG	polyA RNA	illumina hiseq 2000	Lane: L001		Inguinal fat pads were dissected and stored in RNAlater at -80C). Total RNA was isolated using the Trizol Plus RNA extraction kit (Life Technologies) with on-column DNase digestion.;	Following the Illumina TruSeq standard protocol, indexed mRNA-seq libraries were generated from 1μg total RNA followed by QC and quantitation on the Agilent Bioanalyzer and the Kapa Biosystems qPCR library quantitation method.	Subcutaneous Fat	Basecalls were performed with CASAVA version 1.8.0;	Fragmented fastq files from CASAVA were concatenated together, and then reads that did not pass quality filtering were removed with fastq_illumina_filter (http://cancan.cshl.edu/labmembers/gordon/fastq_illumina_filter/);	Single-End Read Alignment - Only the R1 forward read file for each sample was used in this analysis following the methods described in Munger et al. (GENETICS 2014, doi: 10.1534). Individualized transcriptomes (isoform sequences) derived from the genome fasta file and corresponding gene annotation gtf files were used to construct Bowtie-compatible indexes with the rsem-prepare-reference command in RSEM software (Li and Dewey, 2010; RSEM version 1.2.1). The Bowtie aligner (version 0.12.8) was used to align reads to transcript sequences. Alignments with up to three mismatches (-v 3) across the 100bp read were considered valid, but only the best “strata” of alignments were reported. For a given read, the best stratum is the alignment(s) with the fewest mismatches.;	Transcript Abundance Quantitation - Estimates of isoform and gene-level abundance were obtained with RSEM (Li and Dewey 2010). Bowtie alignment files in .bam format were input into the rsem-calculate-expression command. Based on the library fragment size distributions observed on the Agilent Bioanalyzer, fragment length mean was specified as 280bp with a standard deviation of 50bp (RSEM parameters --fragment-length-mean 280 –fragment-length-sd 50). For reads with multiple valid isoform alignments, RSEM implements an expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm that assigns all or a proportion of each multimapping read to one or more isoforms based on the number of uniquely-aligning reads to those transcripts. RSEM estimates isoform expression (counts), and gene-level counts are calculated as the sum of the corresponding isoforms.;	Normalization - For each sample, RSEM count estimates were normalized to the upper quartile value (after trimming zeros).;	Genome_build: Mouse NCBIM37/mm9. Individualized strain genomes were based on NCBIM37 coordinates.;	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: All processed data files are tab-delimited txt files. Each file contains a data matrix with rows representing Ensembl gene identifiers and columns representing samples.	2016-04-11	2016-04-12	Public on Apr 11 2016	SRA	Name: Steven,C,Munger;	Email: steven.munger@jax.org;	Laboratory: Steven Munger;	Institute: The Jackson Laboratory;	Address: 600 Main Street;	City: Bar Harbor;	State: ME;	Zip/postal_code: 04609;	Country: USA	GPL13112
891	{"library preparation":"5’ allphosphate","tissue":"mixed samples from 0 - 64 hr embryos"}	{}	0-64cell_5allphosphate	GSM663623	GSE26955,GSE26957	ascaris suum	library preparation: 5’ allphosphate; tissue: mixed samples from 0 - 64 hr embryos	total RNA	illumina genome analyzer	Ascaris mixed samples from 0 - 64 hr embryos		We constructed three types of small RNA libraries: 1) libraries of 18-34 or 18-40 nt RNAs with a 5’ monophosphate (5’ monophosphate libraries), 2) libraries of 18-34 nt RNAs with a 5’ monophosphate but treated with periodate to enrich for small RNAs with 3’ end modifications (5’ monophosphate, 3’ end modified), and 3) libraries of 18-28 or 18-40 nt RNAs with a 5’ triphosphate, diphosphate, or monophosphate (5’ All-phosphate). Ascaris sample	Following removal of the adaptor sequences from the sequence reads, reads were collapsed to non-redundant datasets and then short reads (<= 17 bp) and low complexity reads were removed. Processed files are in fasta format, with the description of each unique sequence as >number1_number2, where number1 is a unique id and number2 is the total count of the sequence in the library. Note spike sequences are excluded in the processed files, but their number can be found in the raw data and our paper.	2011-01-29	2013-05-23	Public on Jun 16 2011	SRA	Name: Jianbin Wang;	Email: Jianbin.Wang@ucdenver.edu;	Phone: 303-724-3227;	Laboratory: Richard E. paragraphs.text:
%geometa 
SELECT samples.id, samples.title, samples.gsm, samples.gse, organism, samples.characteristics,
           molecules.molecule, sequencers.model,
           samples.description, samples.treatment_protocol, samples.extract_protocol,
           samples.source_name, samples.data_processing,
           samples.submission_date, samples.last_update_date, samples.status,
           samples.type, samples.contact, samples.gpl
  FROM samples, organisms, molecules, sequencers, LOWER(samples.characteristics) as ch, LOWER(organisms.name) as organism
  WHERE samples.organism_id = organisms.id AND samples.molecule_id = molecules.id AND samples.sequencer_id =  sequencers.id AND (ch like '% age %' OR ch like '% age:%') AND organism like '%sapiens%'

46587	CI1 amnion_16	GSM1619161	GSE66302	homo sapiens	tissue: amnion; gestational age: 16; trimester: 2; Sex: Male	total RNA	illumina hiseq 2000			After washing with 0.9% NaCl (Fresenius Kabi, France), the organs and tissues were snap-frozen in buffer RLT (Qiagen, Germany) and stored at -80°C until further use. The organs and tissues were homogenized using a pestle or a syringe needle followed by the QIAshredder homogenizer (Qiagen, Germany). Total RNA was isolated with the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen, Germany) including on-column DNase digestion.; The DeepSAGE libraries were generated as previously described (Mastrokolias et al., 2012; GSE33701). Each library (8 pM) was loaded on a v3 flowcell and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq2000 sequencer (Illumina, USA).	Fetal tissue	Sequencing data was processed with Illumina Pipeline Software version CASAVA 1.8.2.; The FASTQ files were analyzed with a set of custom Perl scripts followed by aligning the sequences against the UCSC hg19 reference genome using Bowtie short read aligner 1.0.0.; The tags were annotated against Ensembl gene identifiers using BIOMART.; Genome_build: UCSC hg19 reference genome; Supplementary_files_format_and_content: raw counts	2015-02-25	2015-05-28	Public on May 28 2015	SRA	Name: Nannan He; Email: N.He@lumc.nl; Institute: Leiden University Medical Center; Address: Einthovenweg 20; City: Leiden; Zip/postal_code: 2333 ZC; Country: Netherlands	GPL11154

61308	DB_Term_2_miRNA	GSM1901219	GSE73713,GSE73714	homo sapiens	tissue: placenta; tissue compartment: Basal plate decidual basalis; gestational age: 39.1 weeks gestation; fetal gender: Female fetus; diagnosis: normal	total RNA	illumina hiseq 2500			Individual paired placental specimens (basal plate decidua basalis and villous trophoblast biopsies) were flash frozen in liquid nitrogen in the Operating Room and stored at -80°C for RNA studies. Total RNA was isolated using TRIzol reagent (Life Technologies, Grand Island, NY, USA) per the manufacturer's recommendations. Total RNA integrity was initially assessed by agarose gel electrophoresis with ethidium bromide labeling in the presence of Protector RNase Inhibitor (Roche) to visualize intact 28S and 18S rRNA bands. The RNA was further purified using an RNA Clean-Up and Concentration Kit (Norgen Biotek, Thorold, Ontario, Canada) prior to sequencing.; Small RNA-Seq libraries were generated using the NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (New England Biolabs, Ipswich, MA), according to the manufacturer's protocols. In brief, 300 ng total RNA (as determined by the Qubit RNA assay, Life Technologies) with an RNA Quality Score > 7 (as determined by the LabChip GX Microfluidics Electrophoresis system, PerkinElmer, Waltham, MA) was used to prepare sequencing libraries. The small RNAs were targeted with modified Illumina-compatible 3’ and 5' adaptors and a reverse transcription primer. Next, first strand synthesis was achieved using Protoscript II Reverse Transcriptase (New England Biolabs), followed by 15 cycles of PCR amplification. The small RNA-Seq libraries were then assessed for relative amounts of micro RNAs (miRNAs) and piwi-interacting RNAs (piRNAs) migrating between 140 to 160 bp using the LabChip GX DNA assay (PerkinElmer). DNA concentrations were assessed using the Qubit fluorometer. Information from the LabChip and Qubit assays allowed pooling of samples prior to size selection using the Pippin Prep system (Sage Science, Beverly, MA). The profile of the combined size-selected libraries was ascertained using the LabChip GX DNA assay. Each pooled library was then sequenced together with other samples tagged with compatible barcodes within a single channel of an Illumina single-read 50 bp flow cell, using the Illumina HiSeq 2500 platform.	Basal plate decidual basalis, placenta	Adapter sequences from the small-RNA-Seq libraries were removed using Cutadapt version 1.4.1.; Trimmed reads were mapped to the miRBase 21 database and tabulated using miRExpress version 2.0.; Genome_build: miRBase 21; Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab-delimited text file of raw (non-normalized) read counts for miRNAs.	2015-10-03	2016-06-15	Public on Jun 14 2016	SRA	Name: William,Edward,Ackerman IV; Email: william.ackerman@osumc.edu; Department: Obstetrics and Gynecology; Institute: The Ohio State University; Address: N521 Doan Hall, 410 West 10th Avenue; City: Columbus; State: Ohio; Zip/postal_code: 43210; Country: USA	GPL16791

The RNA was further purified using an RNA Clean-Up and Concentration Kit (Norgen Biotek, Thorold, Ontario, Canada) prior to sequencing.; Long total RNA-Seq libraries were constructed using the TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Sample Prep Kit with Ribo-Zero Gold (Illumina, San Diego, CA). The Ribo-Zero kit was utilized to remove contaminating ribosomal RNA and mitochondrial RNA while retaining both coding and non-coding long RNAs in the subsequent libraries. A Qubit 2.0 fluorometer (Life Technologies) and BioAnalyzer 2100 system (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) were used to select transcripts of appropriate mass and insert size. The Illumina HiSeq 2500 system and HiSeq version 3 sequencing reagents were used to generate 50 bp single-end reads. Automated clonal amplification was accomplished using the cBOT system (Illumina) using Illumina HiSeq version 3 cluster generation reagents to achieve a target density of approximately 800,000/mm^2 in a single flow cell channel. %geometa
SELECT DISTINCT organism, sequencers.model, samples.gpl
  FROM samples, organisms,  sequencers,  LOWER(organisms.name) as organism
  WHERE samples.organism_id = organisms.id AND samples.sequencer_id =  sequencers.id AND organism like '%sapiens%' AND LOWER(sequencers.model) like '%hiseq 2000%'

paragraphs.text:
%geometa
          SELECT gsm.title AS title, gsm.gsm, gsm.series_id AS gse, gsm.gpl,
                 sequencers.id AS sequencer_id, molecules.id as molecule_id, gsm.organism_ch1 AS organism_id,
                 gsm.characteristics_ch1,
                 gsm.status, gsm.submission_date, gsm.last_update_date, gsm.type, gsm.source_name_ch1 AS source,
                 gsm.treatment_protocol_ch1 AS treatment_protocol, gsm.extract_protocol_ch1 AS extract_protocol,
                 gsm.description, gsm.data_processing, gsm.contact
               FROM gsm, gpl, sequencers, molecules, TRIM(SUBSTRING(LOWER(gpl.title), 0, POSITION('(' IN gpl.title))) as sequencer
               WHERE gsm.gpl = gpl.gpl AND
                 gpl.technology = 'high-throughput sequencing' AND
                 sequencers.model = sequencer AND
                 molecules.molecule = gsm.molecule_ch1 AND
                 gsm.organism_ch1 like '%sapiens%' AND (gsm.characteristics_ch1 like '% age %' OR gsm.characteristics_ch1 like '% age:%' )
               LIMIT 30

Healthy non-smoker	GSM814536	GSE32726,GSE48798	GPL9138	16	6	Homo sapiens	Sex: 3 Female; average age: 29.7; smoking status: 3 Never; lung cancer: 3 No	Public on Oct 07 2013	2011-10-12	2013-10-07	SRA	Large airway epithelial cells	null	300ng of small molecular weight fraction (<200bp) RNA was pooled from individuals within each phenotype, never smoker (NS), current smoker (S), no cancer (NC) and cancer (C), for a total of 4 samples (900ng each).  Each pooled sample was size fractioned using the Ambion flashPAGE fractionator to obtain small RNAs of 10-40nts. Small RNA sequencing libraries were created using SOLiD Small RNA Expression Kit (Ambion) starting with 200ng of the size fractionated small RNA following the manufacturer’s instructions.  Libraries were sequenced on an Applied Biosystems SOLiD System to obtain 36 bp reads.	ABI SOLID small RNA-seq, 36 bp sequencing	The adapter was trimmed off of the 3’ end of each read.  Reads were aligned to the human genome build 19 (hg19) using Bowtie version 0.12.3  allowing up to two mismatches and limiting the number of locations a read can map to the genome to 4 or fewer.  The number of reads that overlap with the genomic locations of known mature microRNA from miRBase v16 and from the miRDeep predictions for miR- 4423 was counted using BEDTools v2.9.0. At the most the ribosomal reads represented 0.3% and the percent of mRNA bases was closed to 55% on average.	null	Basecalls performed using CASAVA version 1.4; Reads were mapped to the human genome (Hg19) using STAR 2.3.0e with default mapping parameters; Read counts were generated from mapped reads using HT-Seq count; Genome_build: Hg19; Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Txt files containing total read counts per gene from HT-Seq counts using mode = "union"	Name: Jeffrey Zhao; Email: zhaoy@mskcc.org; Department: Genomics Core; Institute: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center; Address: 1275 York Avenue; City: New York; State: NY; Zip/postal_code: 10065; Country: USA

H3K27ac_ChIPseq_Human_rep1	GSM1375210	GSE49624,GSE57095	GPL9115	24	2	Homo sapiens	donor age: adult; cell type: sperm; chip antibody: H3K27ac; chip antibody vendor: Active Motif; chip antibody cat. #: # 39135	Public on May 19 2014	2014-04-25	2014-05-19	SRA	H3K27ac_ChIPseq_Human	null	Lysates were clarified from sonicated nuclei and histone-DNA complexes were isolated with antibody.; Libraries were prepared according to Illumina's instructions accompanying the DNA Sample Kit (Part# 0801-0303). Briefly, DNA was end-repaired using a combination of T4 DNA polymerase, E. coli DNA Pol I large fragment (Klenow polymerase) and T4 polynucleotide kinase. The blunt, phosphorylated ends were treated with Klenow fragment (32 to 52 exo minus) and dATP to yield a protruding 3- 'A' base for ligation of Illumina's adapters which have a single 'T' base overhang at the 3’ end. After adapter ligation DNA was PCR amplified with Illumina primers for 15 cycles and library fragments of ~250 bp (insert plus adaptor and PCR primer sequences) were band isolated from an agarose gel. The purified DNA was captured on an Illumina flow cell for cluster generation. Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000 following the manufacturer's protocols.	processed data file: H3K27ac_EnrichedRegions.txt	ChIP-seq data processing and analysis was performed as previously described in Hammoud et al., 2009.  Briefly, differential enrichment between histone ChIP-seq dataset and mononucleosomal control datasets (from GSE15690) were determined with ScanSeqs (USeq), and statistically enriched peaks were called with EnrichedRegionMaker (USeq).; Genome_build: hg18; Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Enrichment were determined with ScanSeqs (USeq), and statistically enriched peaks were called with EnrichedRegionMaker (USeq). Useq files were generated as part of the USeq software collection ChIPseq pipeline.
